In New York City school districts 3, 5, and 6, metal detectors are more often present in schools with higher proportions of minority students.

Metal detector not present

Metal detector present

Metal detector presence unknown

Frederick Douglass

Academy II Secondary School

If a dot falls on this line, that school would have equal proportions of Black and white students. Schools above this line have more Black students than white students.

In District 3, 12 of the 21 schools had metal detectors present.

75 percent schools have a higher proportion of Black students compared to white students.

66 percent have more Latinx students than white students.

District 3

Percent white students

Percent white students

In District 5, 4 of the 8 schools had metal detectors present.

100 percent of these schools have a higher proportion of Black and Latinx students compared to white students.

District 5

Percent white students

Percent white students

In District 6, 5 of the 17 schools had metal detectors present.

80 percent of these schools have a higher proportion of Black students compared to white students.

100 percent have more Latinx students than white students.

District 6

Percent white students

Percent white students

Source: New York Civil Liberties Union. Note: The NYCLU dataset, which compiles quarterly reports from 2016-2022, only includes schools in which NYPD activity has been reported. The NYCLU dataset includes 21 of 53 schools in District 3, 8 of 42 schools in District 5, and 17 of 53 schools in District 6.

Graphic by Trinity Suma

In District 3, 12 of the 21 schools had metal detectors present. 75 percent schools have a higher proportion of Black students compared to white students. 66 percent have more Latinx students than white students.

Source: New York Civil Liberties Union. Note: The NYCLU dataset, which compiles quarterly reports from 2016-2022, only includes schools in which NYPD activity has been reported. The NYCLU dataset includes 21 of 53 schools in District 3, 8 of 42 schools in District 5, and 17 of 53 schools in District 6.
